intro: Torilis praetermissa, commonly known as the common hedge parsley. It is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia, belonging to the Apiaceae family. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, and its leaves are finely divided, resembling those of parsley. It typically grows in disturbed soils and along roadsides, thriving in temperate climates. The plant is often considered a weed but can be found in various habitats across its native range.
